revised_title: Inherited Resistance to Virus Yellows in Sugar Beet: Breeding Strategies and Factors Affecting Resistance
tldr: This article discusses the different types of inherited resistance to virus yellows in sugar beet, including immunity, hypersensitivity, resistance to vectors, resistance to virus inoculation, and virus tolerance. The author describes how these components of resistance can be affected by various factors, such as the concentration of sugars and amino acids in the leaves, and how they can be combined to create monogerm sugar-beet varieties for better virus yellows control.
